abstract.p: Letter from Bob Greco, American Petroleum Institute executive, says that Verlyn Klinkenborg July 20 Editorial Observer on Wyoming's oil and energy boom 'gave short shrift to oil and gas industry's commitment to responsible energy development'

block.p: ''Boom Times in Wyoming, and Worrying Times as Well,'' by Verlyn Klinkenborg (Editorial Observer, July 20), gave short shrift to the oil and gas industry's commitment to responsible energy development.

''Boom Times in Wyoming, and Worrying Times as Well,'' by Verlyn Klinkenborg (Editorial Observer, July 20), gave short shrift to the oil and gas industry's commitment to responsible energy development.

Soaring global energy demand has put increasing pressure on energy supplies. To meet this demand, the industry must go where the resources are -- Wyoming and other parts of the Rockies -- since most resources in Alaska and offshore are currently off limits.
The industry works hard to minimize environmental impact. New technologies allow larger quantities of oil and natural gas to be developed with less effect on land and wildlife.
We cooperate with local stakeholders to ensure that energy development is conducted responsibly.
Protecting our environmental resources and making sure that America has the energy it demands require a constructive partnership among industrial users, consumers, energy companies and government.
That's the only way we can successfully address the nation's energy challenges.
Bob Greco Upstream Director American Petroleum Institute Washington, July 26, 2006
